title: thoughts on the 750 rp skin Queen of diamonds skin for Syndra @riot
body:
I think if you release a 750 rp skin for champions with very little particle effects eg. melee champs 
it would be less disappointing.
but syndra, theres just so much potential to make a good and interesting skin, you just wasted an awesome concept becuase you decided to make it 750 rp and a lot of people WOULD NOT like it.

seeing the Queen of diamonds skin for Syndra makes me sad because if she looks like the skin is like 50% completed.  
the particles does not match the skin at all and its not visually appealing.
if you change the particles to something more attractive and relevant to the theme, im sure a lot of people would be interested in it.

the Sphere is the most important feature of Syndra, and you decided not to change it. whats the point of getting the skin really? 

i dont understand why riot is so stubborn about this. There is seriously something wrong with your pricing strategy!

if i want to buy skin for my champ, i want to make sure its well spent right?
975 rp - $7.5 usd 
750 rp - $5.77 usd 
its a $1.8 usd difference then BAM - you get a complete, nice looking skin. and obviously i would buy it. 
but for 750 rp skins, even if you make this skin for free, i wont use it. 
its not just about the cost of the skin. knowing your favourite champion got a new skin, but it does not feel completed - i wont buy it and then now you have to wait another 1-2 years for it. 

you make the skins more affordable, but at the same time you are letting your players down. especially for those people who love their favourite champion. 

a lot of people dislike 750 rp skins -- its not even worth it to spend money on it at all. 
so please. please reconsider what you gonna do with those 750 rp skins

PS. if you want to know more about what the players think, just go to youtube and read the comments. 

btw, can you stop making ezreal skins please? he just got a debonair and now this.

replies.body:
Hey Jacccey,

First off, thanks for taking the time to voice feedback about the new skins coming out. 

> but syndra, theres just so much potential to make a good and interesting skin, you just wasted an awesome concept because you decided to make it 750 rp and a lot of people WOULD NOT like it.

Absolutely, Syndra does have a lot of potential for skins! We strive to creative various price tiers of skins for champions because there are some people who like all the bells and whistles added to a skin, and there are others who just want a different outfit for their champion. 

> the particles does not match the skin at all and its not visually appealing.

Originally, Syndra's outfit was just red and white, which I agree, would not match her base particles at all. We added in some purple to better match with the base particles. 

> a lot of people dislike 750 rp skins -- its not even worth it to spend money on it at all.
so please. please reconsider what you gonna do with those 750 rp skins

You're right, there are people who don't like 750 RP skins, but there's also a good portion of players who do enjoy them. 

As I've mentioned, we want to make skins at various price tiers for each champion. 

That said, we don't want to release a skin to PBE as a 750 RP skin, and then change it to 975 RP and add particles because we don't want to set the precedence that we're always going to do that. That wouldn't be fair to players if we said, "Oh sure, we'll change these particles" but when players requested pink particles for Sweetheart Annie we said no.

Now I'm not trying to be a dick here but...

> "That said, we don't want to release a skin to PBE as a 750 RP skin, and then change it to 975 RP and add particles because we don't want to set the precedence that we're always going to do that. That wouldn't be fair to players if we said, "Oh sure, we'll change these particles" but when players requested pink particles for Sweetheart Annie we said no."

Making a bad choice once means you should keep doing it?  "Ok, we pissed off the Annie players, now lets do the Syndra mains"  What...?

The particles still look bad with the new model (Which is great by the way), I don't get why this skin is being left to be mediocre when it could be _So much more_.

Players are asking for this, I'm seeing so many threads on here and Reddit about people wanting this skin to see a tier bump.  Delay the skin a patch like you did with the new Fiddle Sticks skin.  He looks like he should be part of the GotS skin line, but he was released later.  Make Syndra 1350/975 and delay her.

> Making a bad choice once means you should keep doing it? "Ok, we pissed off the Annie players, now lets do the Syndra mains" What...?

Our intent isn't to 'piss off' anyone here. Our intent is to give players more options in regards to tiers of skins. Syndra already has to 975 RP skins, so having a 750 RP skin isn't completely outrageous. 

> The particles still look bad with the new model (Which is great by the way), I don't get why this skin is being left to be mediocre when it could be So much more.

I think this is more subjective feedback, as opposed to fact. Originally, her outfit was red and white, which, if we released that to PBE, I'd 100% agree with you that it looked bad. However, realizing we're working with a 750 RP skin, we added purple to the outfit to match the particles a bit better. 

> Delay the skin a patch like you did with the new Fiddle Sticks skin. He looks like he should be part of the GotS skin line, but he was released later. 

This was intended, and this particular skin wasn't delayed by any means.

I see where the OP is coming from, When I first saw the skin I was a little disappointed the particles seemed to look a little out of place. But when I saw it was 750 I was okay with that. I am a player that very much enjoys 750 skins, they are nothing too fancy, but they still look cool. I play Syndra occasionally and am really glad she is getting a 750 skin because I do not play her enough to want to get anything higher priced than that.

While new particles would look nice, I for one am looking forward to a 750 Syndra skin. If someone really wants new particles they can just get one of her other two skins.

> [{quoted}](name=IllumiNarnia,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=0000000000000002,timestamp=2015-04-30T22:29:47.301+0000)
>
> I see where the OP is coming from, When I first saw the skin I was a little disappointed the particles seemed to look a little out of place. But when I saw it was 750 I was okay with that. I am a player that very much enjoys 750 skins, they are nothing too fancy, but they still look cool. I play Syndra occasionally and am really glad she is getting a 750 skin because I do not play her enough to want to get anything higher priced than that.
> 
> While new particles would look nice, I for one am looking forward to a 750 Syndra skin. If someone really wants new particles they can just get one of her other two skins.

This is not the skin that should be 750. She deserves one, sure, but this skin deserves to be done right. There are concepts out there Riot could do for her that don't require changing the particles to be done right. This is not one of them.

There was a post I think here on the boards or maybe reddit, That put forth the idea of having particle upgrades. I'm not sure how riot feels about them, but with the Chromas it seems at least possible in the future to do Particle Upgrades. Something to allow people on limited incomes have the 750 skin that looks really cool, but not the particles that make it a 975. It would be an upgrade that would cost the difference of 225 ( maybe a little more for the upgrade).

If this were to happen I would like to see Marauder Ashe get the particles just for her since it seems to be lacking. Also I wouldn't expect Riot to do anything like take Surprise Party Amumu and strip away all the cool particles and leave it a base skin change. I wouldn't grandfather in old skins by stripping down their particles, but I would take old skins that would benefit from particles and add them. Like Take Uncle Ryze you could add Red/White/Blue(already there) particles as an upgrade to make him even that much cooler. 

idk how Riot feels about this, but I feel like it would help them hit all points of what you guys want to do. Cheap skins and really cool skins all in one. It doesn't make you stop because a skin needs to be 750 even though there are some cool ideas that would push it up to a 975. 

Now I can see how it could be weird to have a Queen of Diamonds Syndra with red balls and one without for clarity, but I think its a minor issue at least on paper.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-30T21:57:57.982+0000)

However, realizing we're working with a 750 RP skin, we added purple to the outfit to match the particles a bit better. 

As there are some gold accents, what would happen if you went gold instead of purple and used the Justicar particles?

> [{quoted}](name=enddot,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=0000000000000007,timestamp=2015-05-01T20:02:28.046+0000)
>
> As there are some gold accents, what would happen if you went gold instead of purple and used the Justicar particles?

GENIUS.

I'm here just to say that I actually noticed the purple in Syndra's outfit, and really appreciated how it made her particles fit much better with the skin (also, it nicely breaks the pattern of bright colors like white and red :))
Just change orbs into diamonds and stop making this so hard

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-30T21:57:57.982+0000)
>
> ...Our intent is to give players more options in regards to tiers of skins. Syndra already has two 975 RP skins, so having a 750 RP skin isn't completely outrageous.
> 
> ...realizing we're working with a 750 RP skin, we added purple to the outfit to match the particles a bit better...

It's freaking barely a difference of just over $2 USD. Big deal to the spenders. This isn't the 1930's.

It doesn't match the particles virtually at all, the tiny purple-lacing is not doing its job then.

Just take the purple away from her outfit & change the orb model color if you won't be changing the shape.

That, or make the purple in the outfit pop a bit more & change the orb-shape to diamond, leaving the color as-is.

> [{quoted}](name=Eyrgos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=0000000000000004,timestamp=2015-05-01T00:36:28.951+0000)
>
> It's freaking barely a difference of just over $2 USD. Big deal to the spenders. This isn't the 1930's.
> 
> It doesn't match the particles virtually at all, the tiny purple-lacing is not doing its job then.
> 
> Just take the purple away from her outfit & change the orb model color if you won't be changing the shape.
> 
> That, or make the purple in the outfit pop a bit more & change the orb-shape to diamond, leaving the color as-is.

I'd rather not Syndra have 3 skins in the same price tier. Even before I read Katey's posts I already knew why they added the purple in the model. It's a decent looking skin in my opinion. Decent enough for 750. Stop trying to make it what you think it deserves to be. They did their best under the circumstance. If Riot did everything the players asked them to without thinking, this game would be much worse than it is now.

> [{quoted}](name=Kinky Ninja Boy,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=00000000000000040000,timestamp=2015-05-02T08:23:05.037+0000)
>
> I'd rather not Syndra have 3 skins in the same price tier. Even before I read Katey's posts I already knew why they added the purple in the model. It's a decent looking skin in my opinion. Decent enough for 750. Stop trying to make it what you think it deserves to be. They did their best under the circumstance. If Riot did everything the players asked them to without thinking, this game would be much worse than it is now.

"They did their best under the circumstance" - that's the problem. They didn't need to put themselves into such a terrible circumstance to begin with. It's incredibly easy to think of a concept (and colours) that will suit a 750 skin for Syndra with her base spheres. But they didn't. They chose a skin concept that could never NOT clash with her spheres and decided to force it into the 750 RP tier because... why not.

Syndra could get a decent 750 skin. But this is not it. It's just like Marauder Ashe - skin concept for a champion that realistically needs 975 at least (Ashe probably needed 1350 for a voice filter) that's thrown into 750 to look/feel terrible because "people like cheap skins". I think Syndra could have a cheap skin and it could be great but it needs to be designed around her spheres not changing colour. The skin team quite clearly made her model this time around with no regard to her spheres, realised it looked awful so added some purple and then threw it out on the PBE hoping for the best.

It's a mess.

I appreciate the responses.  But "intent" doesn't change the result.  And I don't believe 750rp offerings are outrageous, I just believe this skin could easily be so much more, and that this particular concept is having its potential squandered to keep it in a set tier just because Riot HQ has decided it needs to meet a quota or what ever.  I understand there are a lot of sides to this and opinion will vary.  I'm in the "quality over quantity" camp, and I'd much rather have the few skins Syndra will get be of a high quality.  And it would appear to me that I, along with quite a few other Syndra players, are a bit miffed.  But hey, I'm just the consumer, what do I know?

Regardless, it seems that Riot (Whoever is running this skin show) is unwilling to budge in the face of community want, for whatever reason that may be.  Making all of these threads, discussions, suggestions (good ones), and opinions pointless.

And don't get me wrong KateyKhaos, I'm not trying to demonize Riot here or lash out.  I think Riot is one of the best developers of a game I've ever played, and the company deserves a whole lot more praise and far less crap than it gets.  I just don't understand this situation and the companies reasons for not meeting player demand here.  You truly believe upping the ante on this skin isn't what the community at large wants?  Or that increasing the 750RP price point would hurt sales?  Do higher quality, higher priced skins not sell as well as their blander 750 counterparts?

Anyway, this is all just the rambling of one disgruntled player not totally happy with this  particular Syndra offering.  It truly is impossible to please everyone, but  I still  really do wish it would be changed.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-30T21:57:57.982+0000)
>
> Our intent isn't to 'piss off' anyone here. Our intent is to give players more options in regards to tiers of skins. Syndra already has to 975 RP skins, so having a 750 RP skin isn't completely outrageous. 
> 
> I think this is more subjective feedback, as opposed to fact. Originally, her outfit was red and white, which, if we released that to PBE, I'd 100% agree with you that it looked bad. However, realizing we're working with a 750 RP skin, we added purple to the outfit to match the particles a bit better. 
> 
> This was intended, and this particular skin wasn't delayed by any means.

It might be subjective feedback but it seems to be a very popularly held opinion :P I've not actually seen anyone who does think the colours go well together.

Didn't you have a previous discussion where we reached a consensus that particle light champions, such as Yi, should receive 750-975 skins in general, while particle heavy skins, such as Syndra, Jayce, Azir, should receive more expensive skins? Why make a particle heavy champion like Syndra a 750 skin that could easily become a higher tier? Haven't there been plenty of skin ideas that could become 750 instead for her?

Syndra's orbs need to be treated like Shaco's Jack in the Box's or like Orianna's ball, and not like other particles. There will never be a skin that her balls look right with unless it's purple and black, and the chances of such a skin being made are very slim since that's very close to her base model.

Annie's particles were just a nice touch. Syndra's orbs are a necessity. 

Delay the skin release, do it right. It's going to take more planning to come up with a 750 RP skin for Syndra, and that planning is going to have to revolve around the color of her default particles.


PS: why is Ezreal getting his 7th skin with default particles if you're trying to appeal to different price point audiences?

Syndra's orbs are completely different from Shaco's JitB or Orianna's ball - they're both models, as opposed to particles. 750 RP skins receive new models, not particles (unless they're quality of life, such as changing Sivir's spells so it looks like she's throwing the proper weapon in her Warden skin).

We won't be delaying the skin, as we specifically added purple to her outfit so her particles would mesh better. (Originally it was just red and white.)

As mentioned, we felt Ezreal was a good fit for this skin line, even though it's a 750 RP skin, and yes, he does have several already. That said, he's a much older champion, and skins a few years ago, were usually no more than a model change. My statement still stands that we do want different price point skins. That said, his particles are much more ambiguous than other champions', so they don't clash with several thematics/color schemes like  Morgana's base particles would.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=000000020000,timestamp=2015-04-30T21:45:48.552+0000)
>
> Syndra's orbs are completely different from Shaco's JitB or Orianna's ball - they're both models, as opposed to particles. 750 RP skins receive new models, not particles (unless they're quality of life, such as changing Sivir's spells so it looks like she's throwing the proper weapon in her Warden skin).
> 
> **We won't be delaying the skin, as we specifically added purple to her outfit so her particles would mesh better. (Originally it was just red and white.)
> **
> As mentioned, we felt Ezreal was a good fit for this skin line, even though it's a 750 RP skin, and yes, he does have several already. That said, he's a much older champion, and skins a few years ago, were usually no more than a model change. My statement still stands that we do want different price point skins. That said, his particles are much more ambiguous than other champions', so they don't clash with several thematics/color schemes like  Morgana's base particles would.

What is the point of the PBE then? If you're not willing to accept our feedback, simply because you demand to have a skin in multiple price tiers for different champions, why should players give feedback? Why should we care what goes up on the PBE when this is the sort of response that we get? "Absolutely no changes, sorry guys we're just not going to delay the skin to make it better. It's Riot's new creed, 'If it's not ready, release it!' which is a bit different from our old creed of 'We'll release it when it's ready...'"

I mean... I hate to be blunt and a bit harsh with it but that is _exactly _what is being said here, and its disheartening.

PBE is more like a final testing ground than for actual feedback. 

Feedback always helps. But they're going to learn more by having a bunch of random people playing the skin than a few internal people. 

Often things on the PBE are overall finalized because they wouldn't put it on there unless they thought it was OK. At times things will change. Such as the current Rengar skin. Which was changed from player feedback in a way that actually keeps their plans there. 

Their plan for these card skins are to be 750. That wont change. But if you can tell them how to make the skin look better without changing the price they'll listen. If you're going to tell them "It'd look better if you did more to do it, people will pay for it, it's OK". They're going to look the other way. That's not their plan for the skin. 

Yes, the skin could look better. But they want it to be a 750 skin. Try to work with them if you want to see changes. Like having the skirt fade to purple around the edges or changing the boots to purple.

> [{quoted}](name=Cindikle,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=00000002000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-30T23:17:44.259+0000)
>
> PBE is more like a final testing ground than for actual feedback. 
> 
> Feedback always helps. But they're going to learn more by having a bunch of random people playing the skin than a few internal people. 
> 
> Often things on the PBE are overall finalized because they wouldn't put it on there unless they thought it was OK. At times things will change. Such as the current Rengar skin. Which was changed from player feedback in a way that actually keeps their plans there. 
> 
> Their plan for these card skins are to be 750. That wont change. But if you can tell them how to make the skin look better without changing the price they'll listen. If you're going to tell them "It'd look better if you did more to do it, people will pay for it, it's OK". They're going to look the other way. That's not their plan for the skin. 
> 
> Yes, the skin could look better. But they want it to be a 750 skin. Try to work with them if you want to see changes. Like having the skirt fade to purple around the edges or changing the boots to purple.

It doesn't matter that they planned to make it crap, it's still crap. Making a Queen of Diamonds skin more purple will only hurt the skin. They chose wrong, and their current release structure makes sure that their bad decisions can't be fixed. That's unacceptable. There's far more than just this skin that needs to be fixed.

And that's your opinion. You're allowed to have it. 

I think it looks fine. I prefer my Justicar skin. But I have no problems with the skin they are making. 

If it come out with a bundle for all 4 I'd get it for sure and likely use it.

I think players often default to this question when something they're passionate about isn't changed, or particular feedback isn't acted upon, and it's understandable, and may appear that way.

PBE is an opportunity for players to get a first hand look at content, try it out, and leave feedback. We appreciate the PBE community, as well as players who don't have PBE access, but take a look at 3rd party coverage at the content and leave their thoughts on the live boards. 

We make no promise to change everything that's suggested on the boards. That's not because we don't care, or because we don't want to by any means. 

When we plan a skin, we plan scope. (Will the skin have new particles? Will the skin have new VO? Will it have new sounds?) When we decide on the scope of the skin, we then allocate resources to it (animators, particle artists). Resources that aren't being allocated to skin A, are then put on other skins (B,C, etc.) This means that if we scope out a skin which we plan to only have a new model/texture, we don't have a particle artist available to create different particles. When a skin has particles, sure, we can make adjustments to the particles we've created for this skin without much issue. 

It's also not just about the content creation. When we create a skin, we complete a fairly lengthy test plan to ensure the skin is working properly and this includes sweeping all of the champion's older skins. By adding new particles so late in the process, it means we need to begin testing over, which would then throw a wrench in the entire testing pipeline, and could delay and entire patch of skins rather than the one skin in question.

Yes, we delayed Debonair Galio, but that was all model and texture changes, and we already had that resource allocated, and the changes weren't high scope changes. 

I don't think you're being harsh, I think you legitimately care about the content that's coming out, and to be honestly, it means a lot.

I just think the time you end up sharing it with us is inappropriate.

Imagine if you shared the skins with us in the concept phase. When the skin is just art on a tablet/paper/etc.

I already know, that concept may not make it through. Fans don't care though. Once you share these concepts with us you can already judge whether we like it or not and our "helpful" suggestions can be heard at a time when it's actually possible to implement them because I'm sure, that let's say, you made a Christmas Diana. Doesn't matter what she looks like, she's going to have some red on her, maybe some white or green. Generally, be all Christmas-themed, right?

Even if the way the skin looks changes past concept, a fan can offer a great suggestion that *could* be implemented. If the skin doesn't happen at all nobody lost anything except maybe a few fans' hype. They lost their hype. Oh noes.

Try it.

I'd also like to see if you guys could create a "community skin" where you guys start with a concept and ask the community for ideas implicitly.

They do share things with us in the concept phase. Two words: Ao Shin. One more if you're a really old summoner: Omen. We care. We care a lot. It doesn't go over well when we get our hopes up about something awesome and then find out it's not gonna happen (or in Ao Shin's case it's being pushed back multiple years) because it's not really that awesome.

And we also already have community skins. Battle Bunny Riven, DJ Sona, and Void Fizz come to mind immediately and Dragonmaster Swain is still in production last I checked. I suppose we could also throw in Dunkmaster Darius and I could swear I've seen GD threads featuring Garen as a Warhammer 40k space marine long before Steel Legion Garen was a thing. Braum's whole concept drew...heavy inspiration from a community supported champion concept called Angus the Puncher.

Lee Sin is only a thing because the community wanted it. URF was only a thing because the community wanted it. It came back because the community demanded it. Championship Riven is coming back at some point because the community (minus me on that one, I think it should stay locked myself) ~~wouldn't stop moaning~~ demanded it. Flex bundles that don't penalize you for already owning stuff in them are a thing because the community demanded it.

This time they didn't bend over backward to give you what you want. Not because they don't want want to, not because they don't care, but because they understand that giving you what you want in the short term would mean sacrificing a lot more in the long term. Maybe you only play Syndra and only plan on buying this one skin for the entirety of your League career. That's cool, but you're very much the exception rather than the rule. In business sometimes it's better to temporarily offend the 1% so you don't end up offending the 99%.
I think most of us would be in favor of having the rest of the skin line delayed if it means the Syndra skin can fulfill it's potential.

But would you be in favor of not just this skin line but EVERY SKIN CURRENTLY IN PRODUCTION being delayed? If I'm reading correctly, that's what's being stated. It's like having a single lane highway but you realized you missed your exit by a couple hundred feet. Are you really going to stop and expect everyone behind you to go into reverse gear so you can back up to it?

I understand everyone's frustration, it sucks to really like the idea of a skin but there's that...just that one thing that makes it...off somehow. I love Vayne and I love everything about her Dragonslayer skin until I look at the helmet. It just irks me for reasons and it took me years to get over that. Sure to you this might sound like an easy enough change, but that means one of two things: 1) You don't know the kind of work that goes into making that "easy" change. 2) You DO know the kind of work that goes into making that easy change. If it's the second, go on ahead to rito.com/careers and be about it OR mod it yourself and publish it on Leaguecraft or something. If that one guy can take all the female champs, make them topless, and then give them Hindenburg sized boobs, turning purple circles to red circles can't be that bad, right?

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=00000002000000000001,timestamp=2015-04-30T23:53:05.166+0000)

>
> Yes, we delayed Debonair Galio, but that was all model and texture changes, and we already had that resource allocated, and the changes weren't high scope changes...

How the Hey did you guys decide to scope out another Ezreal skin without updated particles? Like, wtf. How little thought do you guys put into scoping out a theme with regards to the particularly chosen champion(s)? Seriously...

And I'm still very upset about the Galio 'improvements,' some of them actually made it worse off than the earlier iteration (the purple...).

Not only that, you cut it's changes off way prematurely. There was still a vast, overwhelming response to the second draft which you put up on PBE.

Especially with regards to the hair, the purple, & the wings.
Just change orbs into diamonds and stop making this so hard

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=pkxhWAa9,comment-id=00000002000000000001,timestamp=2015-04-30T23:53:05.166+0000)
>
> I think players often default to this question when something they're passionate about isn't changed, or particular feedback isn't acted upon, and it's understandable, and may appear that way.

This comes across the wrong way by attempting to undermine the response I gave, by suggesting the response was rhetorical and over-reactive. It was neither, and it was a perfectly fair question of why the players should spend time and effort on the PBE if feedback of certain categories (seemingly, particles changes, not model/texture changes) will be systematically and routinely ignored because time and resources weren't scheduled to deal with any potential PBE feedback of the sort. It is disingenuous to ask for feedback, without putting up a disclaimer that you are NOT searching for feedback of the types X, Y, and Z, because you don't have resources to change it even if you wanted to.

And this is all apart from the fact that Riot has ALWAYS... I cannot emphasize this enough.... ALWAYS been a "Player-focused" company that would always say, in response to "PFE wherE" threads with "It will be out when it is ready."

This philosophy of pigeon-holding skins to a specific price tier, to increase the number of champions that have multiple price tier skins, is working against Riot's history of policy. You can't be a player-focused company if you don't act on feedback because of poor scheduling or a disparity of opinion that the 750 skin holds more value than the 975 skin to the community. If you (Riot) believes a 750 skin is worth more, even when almost universal feedback suggests that something as simple as changing the colors of existing particles would make a skin better and more desirable, who is Riot creating content for then?

>

I have several problems with your reasonings here. I'm sure you've heard them all before from other players, but I'm going to say them again here anyway.

A) "We only have so many artists" - This defense is getting stale and honestly quite annoying. I realize it's true, but it's also pretty damn simple to improve. There are thousands of talented aspiring game artists out there who would LOVE the opportunity to work on League of Legends, even at a limited or temporary capacity. Let them do the minor color changes and tweaks that we ask for but you might not have planned to do. That way your main artists can continue to work on the skin pipeline uninterrupted.

B) "We would have to start testing all over again" - So? Did we ask you to fix it and still ship it tomorrow? No, not at all. This is the PBE. If you're not willing to delay the things that go out there, then you're not putting the stuff out there soon enough. We're more than willing to test some pretty spectacularly broken stuff for you, and you don't even have to pay us. 

C) "We didn't plan on doing that scope of work on it" - NO. Unlike the other two, this is not an acceptable excuse AT ALL in my opinion, for a couple reasons. One, you should never plan a skin that changes the core identity of a particle-driven champ and not plan to at least recolor the particles. Marauder Ashe should have had Blackfrost-style or maybe Bloodstone-style arrows. Inquisitor Nautilus should NOT have green nautical particles. Queen of Diamonds Syndra should have particles to match her new identity. We as players would rather spend a bit more on a skin that is actually done right than have a piece of crap shoved down our throats, especially when the idea is so good. 

The other problem I have with this is that you as a company decided, completely without our input, that we players would rather have a cheaper skin than a good one. You made this decision without us at all and then committed so hard to that outcome that when we finally see the result and tell you how incredibly fucking wrong you are, it's too late and we're stuck with crap. That's not a good business model, and it's biting the players and the skin collectors right in the ass pretty frequently lately.

TLDR: These reasons aren't good enough. Find ways to work around them.
